messages.message: `mysql` already runs as a dependency with every sandbox built from ibdev-backend. We usually use the dependent database for dev. Also, we don't need to use `provisioner.py` to run anything.
Just use `mysql` as the host! You can refer to this document for more details - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1mM32cCbi4NFtphnlu1T8rtsc0lsfj3FZWfNrKmui34M/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.1hqgiirgqwir!

Thank @Vasu.
I do need to run DB tests since I’m making changes to the database. And for that, I need to start the database; otherwise, it gives an error.

I usually do this to run tests.

```python $IB_HOME/provisioner.py start mysql
 
cd $IB_HOME/shared-utils/go-utils/src/instabase/utils/db
bazel test --test_env=DIALECTS=mysql ...```

Hey all as of yesterday these instructions are out of date! The database test now automatically start the database they need. You don’t need provisioner.py anymore. I’ll be updating the database developer guide today.
